learning_outcomes.description: Understand the study of nutrition from a public health perspective.
Collect, analyse, interpret and evaluate data to assess the nutrition needs of a  population.
Understand and evaluate the use of a range of tools and  methods for assessing and monitoring nutrition at the population level.
Understand the contextual determinants of population nutrition at individual, community and environmental levels.
Demonstrate skills in written and oral communication, and in group work including collaboration, teamwork and group negotiation.

assessments.task_description: Online activity to critically assess Nutrition Research Methods and Epidemiology. More details will be available on Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission is via Blackboard and more information will be available during tutorials and on Blackboard
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: This task will require students to work in groups and complete a critical evaluation of nutrition research. Specific pre reading will be required prior to the tutorial and will be made available for students on Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The task will be completed and submitted within the tutorial time. All students must attend their assigned tutorial.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: This is an individual assessment task and will be completed during the lecture timeslot. This assessment will assess your understanding of course content, and your ability to apply concepts that you have learnt in the course in practical contexts.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Investigation of a Population Nutrition issue
assessments.task_description: This is a group assessment task. Students will need to form groups and start work on this task early. Each group of 4-5 students will collect data, and present your work via a presentation. Topics will be available on Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Final Submission is via Blackboard. One submission per group.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
